title: The Reed's Lament
content: Listen to the reed, how it tells a tale, complaining of separations, saying: Since I was parted from the reedbed, my lament has caused man and woman to moan.

title: The Beloved in Your Heart
content: You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life? In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art, this music, this form.

title: The Guest House
content: This being human is a guest house. Every morning a new arrival. A joy, a depression, a meanness, some momentary awareness comes as an unexpected visitor. Welcome and entertain them all! Even if they are a crowd of sorrows, who violently sweep your house empty of its furniture, still, treat each guest honorably. He may be clearing you out for some new delight.

title: The Breeze at Dawn
content: The breeze at dawn has secrets to tell you. Don't go back to sleep! You must ask for what you really want. Don't go back to sleep! People are going back and forth across the doorsill where the two worlds touch. The door is round and open. Don't go back to sleep!

title: The Wound is Where Light Enters
content: The wound is the place where the Light enters you. Don't turn your head. Keep looking at the bandaged place. That's where the light enters you. Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing, there is a field. I'll meet you there.

title: Love is the Cure
content: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding. Love is the cure, for your pain will keep giving birth to more pain until your eyes constantly exhale love as effortlessly as your body yields its scent.

title: The Lamp
content: Be like melting snow â€” wash yourself of yourself. A candle never loses any of its light while lighting other candles. Be a lamp, or a lifeboat, or a ladder. Help someone's soul heal. Walk out of your house like a shepherd.

title: The Reed Flute's Song
content: Listen to the story told by the reed, of being separated. Since I was cut from the reedbed, I have made this crying sound. Anyone apart from someone he loves understands what I say. Anyone pulled from a source longs to go back.

title: The Mysterious Source
content: We are not just drops in the ocean, but the entire ocean in each drop. The Beloved is nearer to you than your own neck vein. Why do you search for the Beloved? You are the Beloved! Yet still we say: Show us where you are. You are where the heart is, you are where love is.

title: The Dance of Existence
content: Dance, when you're broken open. Dance, if you've torn the bandage off. Dance in the middle of the fighting. Dance in your blood. Dance when you're perfectly free. Gamble everything for love, if you're a true human being.

title: The Tavern of Love
content: In the tavern of love, the wine is always fresh. Here, the lovers drink the wine of longing, and become drunk on divine love. The tavern keeper is God himself, pouring wine for those who thirst for the divine.

title: The Empty Mirror
content: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment. The mirror of the heart must be clear of the dust of thoughts. When the mirror is polished clean, it reflects the Friend's face. Polish your heart continuously that it may reflect divine light.

title: The Lover's Journey
content: Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray. The minute I heard my first love story, I started looking for you, not knowing how blind that was. Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.

title: The Garden of Truth
content: In the garden of mystic lovers, these are not true distinctions. Every moment of your life is either heaven or hell. Choose love, and heaven is yours. Choose fear, and you create your own hell. The garden blooms for those who water it with tears of longing.

title: The Whirling of the Soul
content: I tried to find Him on the Christian cross, but He was not there; I went to the Temple of the Hindus and to the old pagodas, but I could not find a trace of Him anywhere. I searched the mountains and the valleys but neither in the heights nor in the depths was I able to find Him. I went to the Kaaba in Mecca, but He was not there either. I questioned the scholars and philosophers but He was beyond their understanding. I then looked into my heart and it was there where He dwelled that I saw Him; He was nowhere else to be found.

title: The Flame of Love
content: Love is a flame that burns everything other than itself. It is the destroyer of all that is false and the revealer of all that is true. When you love, you become the flame. When you become the flame, you become love itself. This is the alchemy of the heart.
